metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.2 runoff observation system of 312 bridge on the Heihe River, 2015)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（2号点-312桥径流观测数据-2015）
metadata.description:
The data set includes the river level observation data of point 2 in the dense runoff observation of the middle reaches of Heihe River from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015. The observation point is located in Heihe bridge, 312 National Road, Zhangye City, Gansu Province. The riverbed is sandy gravel with unstable section. The longitude and latitude of the observation point are n38.996667 °, e100.427222 °, altitude 1485m, river width 70m and 20m. Sr50 ultrasonic range finder is used for water level observation, with acquisition frequency of 30 minutes. The data includes the following parts:            
Water level observation, observation frequency 30 minutes, unit (CM);            
In 2015, the section of bridge no.2-312 was frequently disturbed by human beings. The dam was built within 1km of the upstream and downstream of the section. The unstable area of the hydrological section led to the disorder of the water level and flow curve. During the measurement, the stable flow and water level curve could not be obtained.            
The observation of water level is based on the manual observation of water level at 0:00 on January 1, 2015. In the later stage, the hydrological section of river undercut changes. The result is that the datum water level changes and negative value appears;            
Refer to Li et al. (2013) for hydrometeorological network or station information, and he et al. (2016) for observation data processing
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日的黑河中游径流加密观测中2号点的河流水位观测数据。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市312国道黑河桥，河床为砂砾石，断面不稳定。观测点的经纬度是N38.996667°，E100.427222°，海拔1485米，河道宽度，70米、20米。水位观测采用SR50超声测距仪，采集频率30分钟。数据包括以下部分：
水位观测，观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）； 
2015年2号点-312桥断面受到频繁人为扰动，断面上下游1km里范围内堤坝修建，水文断面面积不稳定导致水位流量曲线紊乱，测量期间未能获取稳定的流量水位曲线。
水位观测以2015年1月1日0：00时人工观测水位为标准，后期河道下切水文断面变化。导致测量基准水位发生改变出现负值；
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system are arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including a superstation within the oasis, four EC towers, and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations in different landscapes. Additionally, 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按层级嵌套的尺度排列，包括绿洲内的一个超级站、四个涡度相关塔和四个位于不同景观的双层自动气象站。此外，进行了12次机载遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used in the observation of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个在绿洲-沙漠地区观察生态水文过程时使用的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method used in the observation of eco-hydrological processes involves the use of a flux observation matrix comprising eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This setup is designed to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, as demonstrated in the HiWATER experiment.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于观察生态水文过程的数据收集方法涉及使用一个通量观测矩阵，该矩阵包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。该设置旨在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge encountered when collecting multiscale observation data in heterogeneous terrains?
Example.QuestionCn: 在异质地形中收集多尺度观测数据时遇到的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge encountered is the poor availability of multiscale observations in heterogeneous terrains, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes. The HiWATER experiment addresses this by employing hierarchically nested scales to obtain comprehensive multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个遇到的挑战是，在异质地形中多尺度观测的可用性差，这阻碍了生态水文过程的上尺度化进展。HiWATER实验通过采用分层嵌套尺度来获取全面的多尺度和多学科数据，从而解决这一问题。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used for hydrological observations in oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于水文观测的数据收集方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological variables, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, high temporal resolution, half-hourly intervals, 10-minute intervals
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站、能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、水文气象变量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、高时间分辨率、半小时间隔、10分钟间隔。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with obtaining stable flow level curves in river observation datasets?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在河流观测数据集中获取稳定流量水平曲线所面临的挑战有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: frequent human disturbances, construction activities, changes in the riverbed
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 频繁的人为干扰、施工活动、河床变化

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features of datasets are crucial for understanding the oasis-desert interactions and supporting sustainable development?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠互动和支持可持续发展的数据集特征有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, radiation, soil moisture, temperature profiles, vegetation parameters, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期观测的能量、水汽、碳通量、水文气象数据、辐射、土壤湿度、温度剖面、植被参数、土壤参数

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'multiscale observations' mean in the context of eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，“多尺度观测”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of eco-hydrological research, 'multiscale observations' refer to collecting data across different spatial and temporal scales to comprehensively understand eco-hydrological processes. This approach involves using a variety of instruments and techniques to capture data on different scales, such as flux observation matrices, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies, to address the challenge of upscaling these processes in heterogeneous environments.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究的背景下，“多尺度观测”是指在不同的空间和时间尺度上收集数据，以全面理解生态水文过程。这种方法涉及使用多种仪器和技术来捕获不同尺度的数据，例如通量观测矩阵、自动气象站和遥感技术，以应对在异质环境中对这些过程进行上尺度处理的挑战。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'eddy covariance system' in measuring energy and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: 涡度相关系统在测量绿洲-沙漠地区的能量和碳通量方面有什么重要意义？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'eddy covariance system' is significant in measuring energy and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert areas as it provides half-hourly turbulent flux data that are crucial for understanding the exchange of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane between the land surface and the atmosphere. This system helps in capturing the dynamics of these exchanges, which are essential for understanding ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in these regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: “涡度协方差系统”在测量绿洲-沙漠地区的能量和碳通量方面具有重要意义，因为它提供了每半小时的湍流通量数据，这对于理解地表与大气之间能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷的交换至关重要。该系统有助于捕捉这些交换的动态，这对于理解生态稳定性和支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'data quality control' entail in the context of hydrological and meteorological datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文和气象数据集的背景下，“数据质量控制”涉及哪些内容？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of hydrological and meteorological datasets, 'data quality control' entails a series of processes designed to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the collected data. This includes sensor calibration, careful data collection, processing, and archiving. It ensures that the datasets generated are of high quality, which is critical for their effective use in research and decision-making.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在水文和气象数据集的背景下，“数据质量控制”包括一系列旨在确保所收集数据的准确性和可靠性的过程。这包括传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、处理和归档。它确保生成的数据集具有高质量，这对于在研究和决策中有效使用至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for water level observation using SR50 ultrasonic sensors compare to the eddy covariance system and scintillometer methods for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: SR50超声波传感器用于水位观测的数据收集方法与涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪方法在测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The SR50 ultrasonic sensors are used for water level observation with a 30-minute frequency, focusing on hydrological metrics in river systems. In contrast, the eddy covariance system and scintillometer methods are used to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, capturing ecological and atmospheric interactions, with a high temporal resolution of half-hourly data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: SR50超声波传感器用于水位观测，频率为30分钟，专注于河流系统的水文指标。相比之下，涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪方法用于测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量，捕捉生态和大气相互作用，具有半小时的数据高时间分辨率。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges in data collection can be inferred from the need for multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从生态水文过程需要多尺度观测中可以推断出数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The need for multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes suggests challenges such as the difficulty in capturing comprehensive data across different spatial and temporal scales. This is due to the complex interactions within heterogeneous surfaces, as highlighted by the poor availability of multiscale observations that hinder progress in the field.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程对多尺度观测的需求表明了诸多挑战，例如在不同空间和时间尺度上捕捉全面数据的困难。这是由于异质表面内复杂的相互作用所致，正如多尺度观测的稀缺性所强调的，这阻碍了该领域的进展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in obtaining stable flow-stage curves in river hydrological observations, particularly in areas with frequent human disturbances?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在河流水文观测中，特别是在频繁受到人类干扰的地区，获取稳定流量-阶段曲线的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in obtaining stable flow-stage curves are primarily due to frequent human disturbances such as dam construction within 1 km of the measurement site, which cause instability in the stream cross-section area.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 获得稳定流量阶段曲线的挑战主要是由于测量点1公里范围内频繁的人为干扰，例如水坝建设，这导致了河流横截面积的不稳定。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is the availability of multiscale observations considered insufficient for understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测的可用性被认为不足以理解异质表面的生态水文过程，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The insufficiency of multiscale observations arises because capturing eco-hydrological processes requires instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, which has historically been lacking, thereby hindering progress in understanding these processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的不足在于，捕捉生态水文过程需要在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器配置，而历史上这一点一直缺乏，从而阻碍了对这些过程的理解进展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes instability in the baseline water level measurements in river hydrological studies over time?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在河流水文研究中，导致基线水位测量随时间不稳定的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Instability in baseline water level measurements can occur due to changes in river channel morphology, such as riverbed incision, which alters the hydrological cross-section and subsequently affects the measurement baseline.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 基线水位测量的不稳定性可能由于河道形态的变化而发生，例如河床切割，这会改变水文横截面，从而影响测量基线。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of frequent human disturbances on hydrological data collection methods in river channels?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 频繁的人为干扰对河流通道水文数据收集方法的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Frequent human disturbances in river channels, such as construction within the vicinity of observation points, lead to instability in hydrological cross-sectional areas. This causes disruptions in water level-flow curves, making it challenging to obtain stable data for hydrological observations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 频繁的人为干扰河道，例如在观测点附近的建设，导致水文横截面区域的不稳定。这会导致水位-流量曲线的干扰，使得获取稳定的水文观测数据变得困难。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the hierarchical nesting of observation instruments impact the quality and comprehensiveness of eco-hydrological datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 观察仪器的层级嵌套如何影响生态水文数据集的质量和全面性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Hierarchical nesting of observation instruments allows for the capture of multiscale eco-hydrological processes, leading to the generation of comprehensive datasets. This setup includes a variety of instruments such as eddy covariance towers, scintillometers, and remote sensing tools, which together enhance the quality and breadth of data collected across different landscape types.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 观察仪器的层次嵌套能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，从而生成综合数据集。该设置包括多种仪器，如涡度协方差塔、闪烁仪和遥感工具，这些仪器共同提高了在不同景观类型中收集数据的质量和广度。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What is the effect of integrating multiscale and multidisciplinary data on understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合多尺度和多学科数据对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale and multidisciplinary data facilitates a nuanced understanding of oasis-desert interactions by providing detailed insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. This integrated approach supports the ecological security and sustainable development of oasis systems by offering a quantitative understanding of these interactions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度和多学科数据有助于深入理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，提供有关能量、水汽和碳交换过程的详细见解。这种综合方法通过提供对这些相互作用的定量理解，支持绿洲系统的生态安全和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to establish a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interactions in eco-hydrological studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，建立稀疏网络以调查绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Establishing a sparse network enables capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments in hierarchically nested scales, thus addressing the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations in the field.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 建立稀疏网络可以通过将仪器按层次嵌套的尺度排列来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，从而解决现场多尺度观测稀缺的问题。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集绿洲-沙漠系统中长期能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to achieve a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and sustainable socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持绿洲的生态稳定和可持续社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to implement intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations in eco-hydrological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，实施强化观测期（IOPs）和持续的水文气象观测是必要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Intensive observation periods and continuous observations help overcome the challenge of insufficient multiscale data, allowing researchers to capture comprehensive eco-hydrological processes and interactions within oasis-desert systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 密集观察期和持续观察有助于克服多尺度数据不足的挑战，使研究人员能够捕捉到绿洲-沙漠系统内全面的生态水文过程和相互作用。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental and procedural steps are involved in setting up an eco-hydrological sensor network to capture multiscale and multidisciplinary data?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 建立生态水文传感器网络以捕获多尺度和多学科数据所涉及的仪器和程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Procedural steps include arranging instruments in hierarchically nested scales, establishing a sparse network to investigate ecosystem interactions, and constructing superstations and automatic meteorological stations in diverse landscapes. Instruments like eddy covariance towers, scintillometers, and airborne remote sensing tools such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers are used to capture data at multiple scales.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 程序步骤包括将仪器按层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，建立稀疏网络以研究生态系统相互作用，以及在多样化的景观中构建超级站和自动气象站。使用涡度协方差塔、闪烁计以及航空遥感工具如激光雷达和成像光谱仪等仪器，在多个尺度上捕获数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to address challenges in maintaining stable hydrological measurements in areas with frequent human disturbances affecting riverbed conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在频繁的人为干扰影响河床条件的地区，采用哪些程序来应对保持稳定水文测量的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Procedures involve using instruments like SR50 ultrasonic distance meters for water level observation, understanding changes in hydrological cross-section due to human disturbances, and adjusting measurement baselines when the riverbed conditions change. Frequent calibration and data validation are necessary to account for these instabilities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 程序涉及使用SR50超声波测距仪进行水位观测，理解由于人为干扰导致的水文横截面变化，以及在河床条件变化时调整测量基线。频繁的校准和数据验证是必要的，以应对这些不稳定性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在干旱地区收集多尺度生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of hierarchically nested scales for instrumentation, including the flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer, enables the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in arid regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔的通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及高分辨率的机载遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，使得在干旱地区能够收集多尺度的生态水文数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods are used to ensure the quality control of hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，确保水文气象数据质量控制的方法有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Methods used to ensure the quality control of hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems include careful sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. These steps are crucial for maintaining the integrity and reliability of data collected over long-term periods from various instruments like automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 确保绿洲-沙漠系统水文气象数据质量控制的方法包括仔细的传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。这些步骤对于维护从各种仪器（如自动气象站和涡度协方差系统）长期收集的数据的完整性和可靠性至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are some anticipated challenges in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据的一些预期挑战是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems is challenging due to the poor availability of multiscale observations and the need for instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to capture diverse data types. An extensive setup, including flux observation matrices, remote sensing, and ground measurements, is necessary to address these challenges.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据具有挑战性，因为多尺度观测的可用性较差，并且需要在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以捕捉多样的数据类型。为了应对这些挑战，需要建立一个广泛的设置，包括通量观测矩阵、遥感和地面测量。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using SR50 ultrasonic distance meters in collecting hydrological data in dynamic and unstable riverbeds?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在动态和不稳定的河床上使用SR50超声波测距仪收集水文数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of SR50 ultrasonic distance meters is effective for collecting hydrological data such as river water levels with a high frequency of 30 minutes. However, in dynamic and unstable riverbeds, like the one described with frequent human disturbances and changing cross-sectional areas, the reliability of the data may be compromised. Therefore, while the method is technically sound, the environmental and anthropogenic factors pose significant challenges to data accuracy and consistency.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: SR50超声波测距仪在以30分钟的高频率收集水文数据（如河流水位）方面是有效的。然而，在动态和不稳定的河床环境中，例如频繁有人为干扰和变化的横截面积，数据的可靠性可能会受到影响。因此，尽管该方法在技术上是合理的，但环境和人为因素对数据的准确性和一致性构成了重大挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the potential for remote sensing technologies to enhance data collection capabilities in eco-hydrological studies of oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对遥感技术在提高绿洲-沙漠系统生态水文研究数据收集能力方面的潜力有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and thermal imagers, offer significant potential to enhance data collection capabilities by providing multiscale and multidisciplinary observations. These technologies can capture eco-hydrological processes across diverse landscapes and improve understanding of oasis-desert interactions. However, the integration of these technologies requires careful data processing and calibration to ensure quality control and accurate representations of the observed phenomena.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪和热成像仪，提供了显著的潜力来增强数据收集能力，通过提供多尺度和多学科的观测。这些技术能够捕捉不同景观中的生态水文过程，并改善对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解。然而，这些技术的集成需要仔细的数据处理和校准，以确保质量控制和对观察现象的准确表征。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your view, what are the main challenges in maintaining long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid regions, and how might these challenges be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维护长期观测数据集的主要挑战是什么？这些挑战可能如何得到解决？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The main challenges in maintaining long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid regions include ecological degradation such as river and lake drying, natural vegetation loss, land desertification, and dust storms. These environmental changes can disrupt data collection efforts and affect the stability of measurement sites. Addressing these challenges requires robust data collection and quality control methods, strategic placement of observation stations, and a comprehensive understanding of regional ecological dynamics to adaptively manage and preserve the observational infrastructure.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维护长期观测数据集的主要挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被丧失、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些环境变化可能会干扰数据收集工作，并影响测量站点的稳定性。应对这些挑战需要强有力的数据收集和质量控制方法、观察站的战略布置，以及对区域生态动态的全面理解，以便适应性地管理和保护观测基础设施。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not sure how multiscale observations are effectively integrated to enhance eco-hydrological process understanding in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定如何有效整合多尺度观测，以增强对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the HiWATER experiment, multiscale observations are integrated through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. This includes flux observation matrices of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, supplemented by hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing and synchronical ground measurements.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在HiWATER实验中，通过在分层嵌套的尺度上集成仪器进行多尺度观测，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，辅以超高分辨率的航空遥感和同步的地面测量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand what specific challenges are faced in maintaining stable measurements of river discharge in variable desert environments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在多变的沙漠环境中维持河流流量稳定测量面临哪些具体挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining stable river discharge measurements in desert environments include the instability of river cross-sections due to frequent human disturbances, such as dam construction, which can lead to a lack of stable stage-discharge curves. Additionally, changes in the hydrological cross-section can cause variations in base water level measurements.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在沙漠环境中，维持稳定的河流流量测量面临的挑战包括由于频繁的人为干扰（如水坝建设）导致河流横截面的不稳定，这可能导致缺乏稳定的水位-流量曲线。此外，水文横截面的变化可能导致基准水位测量的变化。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the methods used to ensure the quality and reliability of hydrometeorological data collected in semi-arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在半干旱地区收集的水文气象数据的质量和可靠性确保方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The methods used to ensure quality and reliability include careful quality control throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. This involves using automatic weather stations for continuous monitoring and applying a rigorous data processing and quality control procedure, which includes data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 确保质量和可靠性的方法包括在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的整个过程中进行仔细的质量控制。这涉及使用自动气象站进行持续监测，并应用严格的数据处理和质量控制程序，包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous landscapes and suggest potential enhancements to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在异质景观中收集多尺度生态水文数据所面临的挑战，并建议潜在的改进措施以克服这些挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Progress in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, as mentioned in the metadata. The HiWATER experiment addresses this by using a hierarchically nested scale instrumentation to capture multiscale data. Enhancements could include expanding the network of observational stations to cover more diverse landscapes, employing more advanced remote sensing technologies, and increasing the frequency of intensive observation periods to improve data resolution and reliability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制，如元数据中所提到的。HiWATER实验通过使用分层嵌套的尺度仪器来捕捉多尺度数据，从而解决了这一问题。改进措施可以包括扩大观测站网络，以覆盖更多样化的景观，采用更先进的遥感技术，以及增加密集观测期的频率，以提高数据的分辨率和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide a detailed analysis of the data collection methods used to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems and discuss their effectiveness.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供关于用于测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法的详细分析，并讨论它们的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems involve using eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations. These methods collect data on turbulent fluxes, radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and more. The effectiveness of these methods lies in their ability to capture detailed and continuous data, providing valuable insights into the oasis–desert interactions. However, challenges such as data quality control and the need for long-term observations remain critical for ensuring data reliability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站。这些方法收集关于湍流通量、辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度、湿度、风速等的数据。这些方法的有效性在于能够捕捉详细和连续的数据，为绿洲-沙漠相互作用提供宝贵的见解。然而，数据质量控制和长期观测的需求等挑战仍然是确保数据可靠性的重要因素。
